person.persName: Solomon Meredith (Wayne County, Indiana, clerk and soldier)

body.p: Wayne County, Indiana, county court clerk and soldier. Guilford County, North Carolina native. Married to Anna Hannah on March 17, 1835. Father of Mary Meredith, Samuel H. Meredith, David M. Meredith, and Henry C. Meredith. Elected Wayne County sheriff in 1834 and 1836. Worked in the mercantile business, from 1838 to 1848. Elected to the Indiana House of Representatives in 1846, 1847, 1848, and 1854. Delegate to the Whig national convention in 1840 and 1848. Appointed U.S. marshal for Indiana in April 1849 and removed from that position in April 1853. State marshal in Cambridge City, Indiana, in 1850. Delegate to the Republican national convention in 1856. Elected county court clerk in 1859. Wayne County court clerk in 1860. Commissioned as colonel of the 19th Indiana Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) in July 1861. Promoted to brigadier general on October 6, 1862. Wounded at the Battle of Gettysburg in July 1863 and disabled until November 1863. Served as commander at Cairo, Illinois and Paducah, Kentucky in 1864. Brevetted major general on August 14, 1865.
